page.title: 04Fraserburgh Fishermen
page.content: My dad owns the "Silver Fern". He is always busy making charts, buying stores, mending nets ready to go out. A fisherman has a very dangerous job. My dad collects the crew and the food for the boat. He pair trawls with the "Valiant". My dad goes 300 miles North_East of Fraserburgh to the fishing grounds. The "Valiant" shoots his net then tows for 3 hours. While he is towing, the crew relax.They pull the net and get from 25-100 boxes. My dad is on the "Taits",a purser.He leaves at midnight on Sunday for Shetland and arrives at the fishing grounds at midday .When the sonar goes "bing bong" it has found some fish.My dad gets a call then goes up on deck. He puts on oilskins and works the winch. The net goes! The fish go into a tank. They then land them in Holland.
